availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Claiborne James Walton (Hart County, Kentucky, physician, politician and army surgeon.)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, physician, politician, and surgeon. Kentucky native. Son of John L. Walton. Married to Nancy E. Maxey Walton in Hart County, Kentucky, on December 3, 1857. Father of Mary L. Walton and Mattie Walton. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Hart County from 1851 to 1853. Graduated from the University of Louisville, in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1853. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1855 to 1863. Physician in Hart County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Hart County in 1860. Served in the 21st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a surgeon from December 13, 1861, to February 7, 1865. Captured near Atlanta, Georgia, on August 26, 1864. Paroled on September 3, 1864.
